query: Write a summary for the scene.
gt: Rebecca Adler (Robin Tunney), a 29-year-old kindergarten teacher, becomes dysphasic and collapses in her classroom. Dr. Gregory House initially refuses the case until Dr. James Wilson tells him that Rebecca is his cousin. When Dr. Lisa Cuddy tries to make House fulfill his clinical duties, he refuses but is forced to do them when his authorization to the MRI is revoked. He diagnoses Rebecca with cerebral vasculitis and her condition improves with treatment. To find the source of Rebecca's seizures, House convinces Dr. Eric Foreman to break into Rebecca's house. At the hospital, Rebecca suddenly loses her vision and suffers another seizure. Foreman discovers ham at Rebecca's house, revealing both Wilson's lie (Wilson is Jewish and the presence of ham indicates Rebecca is not, thereby suggesting the two are not related) and the cause of the seizure-tapeworms (namely, a tapeworm larva embedded in her brain). When Rebecca refuses treatment, House persuades her otherwise by proving her condition with a non-invasive X-ray suggested by Dr. Robert Chase, which depicts a tapeworm larva embedded in her leg, supporting their diagnosis. Final diagnosis: Neurocysticercosis

The episode continues to an end, leaving the viewers uncertain if the theory is correct or not.

Complete Assignment: Write a Narrative, 200-250 words for the above mentioned scene.\
You are a free lance journalist and have been assigned to interview Saleena Lockhart who is known as a Psychic Seer. You are told that she is the one who provided crucial information leading to the discovery of the Brian McAllister, who was the missing brother of Thomas McAllister. The case was handed over to the National Crime Investigation Services [NCIS] for further investigation as the disappearance was suspicious. You have heard a lot of discussion about Saleena and are curious to know about her special powers, you approach her with a notebook and pen in hand and ask for an interview. She agrees and takes you to her studio. You start writing your notes as she starts describing Brian McAllister. "He was an ex-Lieutenant of the Marines and was missing for two years. He had come to me for guidance," she said. "He was searching for answers to his past. He was someone who had had nightmares every night and couldn't rest until he found out the truth. I told him that I could access information from many years earlier," she added. Suddenly she made some remarks about Brian's father that caught your attention, "Thomas was an abusive husband and he had mistreated Brian. McAllister didn't want his son to have anything to do with him." You realize that she is describing Brian's father and wondered why she would mention Thomas's abusive behavior towards Brian. You had to finish your assignment and you were not sure what to make of it all. For Saleena, Brian and Thomas are not just a couple of people, they hold an important place in her life, as she claims to have helped them in one way or the other.
